resources.string: -In-app full change log\n-Updated app logo to match with playstore icon\n-Major changes in \'about\' section
-Select-able text in forums.\nA user suggestion. Thanks.
-Removed startapp (the malware that you hear about in comments)
-Updated target to latest android version. A new look !
-Fixed filelisting force close issue for Moodle 2.3
-Improved app logo\n-14% reduction in app size!
-UI improvement\n-Download issue on IITB moodle fixed
-Fixed an FC, occurring while fetching files some particular courses
-Fixed many fc issues\n-multiple download support (up to 2)\n-Auto saving of credentials

MDroid was developed just to work with IIT Bombay and has been made generic hoping that it could benefit, if not all, at least a few more students like me. I would appreciate if you consider, even if it didn\'t work out for you, the time and efforts I have put in before you rate this \n - MDroid never puts notification banners or in-app ads \n - While changing server don\'t forget http:\\\\
Praveen Kumar Pendyala, \nDepartment of Electrical Engineering, \nIIT Bombay

All the development related to MDroid, which include the app development from scratch, Logos, Website updation, MDroid stats, Video demos and snapshots, are done by the developer. For any issues related to contents of the fore mentioned aspects and privacy concerns you may write directly to the his mailbox,\n praveen@praveenkumar.co.in \nwith subject as \"MDroid\"
Raghavendra Bommaraju, \nDepartment of CSE, \nIIT Madras for all his techinical support and encouragement.
MDroid is a Moodle application for Android built with an aim to save you the pains of opening moodle website on your mobile browser to download files or viewing forums.
IIT Bombay Moodle - http://moodle.iitb.ac.in \nIIT Madras, CSE Moodle - http://www.cse.iitm.ac.in/moodle

MDroid fetches contents by opening moodle webpage and parsing the HTML response by looking at patterns to get required data. \nAs it uses parsing of strings to get data and not some web services it is not expected to work on all servers as the response strings could vary if the webpage is themed.
MDroid doesn\'t use any Android version specific tools and is expected to work well irrespective of device model or Android version
File extension issues while storing files offline
A good rating is all I hope for the time I spent in development and continious support.

Login 
Course listing 
File listing 
Forums 
Discussions 
Offline course listing 
Offline file listing 
Saving credentials 
Changing server 
File opening errors

Username - username or LDAP Id for login 
Password - password for login 
Remember password - Remembers username and password and takes autologin the next time you open the application. 
NOTE: Username is always saved on login irrespective of the above preference.
Lists all your courses available under your account on Moodle server

Files : Lists files of a selected course 
from Resources - files of a selected course in the resources section 
from Forums - files of a selected course uploaded on forums as attachements 
Download - Indicates that the file is not available offline. Click download to make it available offline 
Open - Indicates that file is available and can be opened 
Downloading - The file is being downloaded. You can run a maximum of two parllel downloads 
Additional details like the file size and datetime of download are shown for the offline files
